In version 1.27.0, before all the changes to concurrency limits, setting the overall cloud to 0 skipped all concurrency limit checking, even if the pod template had one set. Is that the expected behavior?
I was thinking that the pod template level limit should be obeyed when the overall cloud is unlimited.

timeline.message: test for negative to mean unlimited

timeline.bodyText:
So this is going beyond reverting #828; now you are making API server calls even when no caps are in place, which would be a performance regression.
I think this method instead needs to be altered in structure. First, if containerCap is not infinite, compute allPods and check its size. Then, if template.instanceCap is not infinite, compute labelPods and check its size. If neither of those returns false then you return true by default.
And the method should be renamed to clarify that it is not actually adding a provisioned agent, but checking whether we may add a provisioned agent.

replies.bodyText: Thank you sir for the check, I don't disagree. Looking into it.
